parameters.definition: Units of materials required to make one basketball
Hours required to make one basketball
Units of materials required to make one football
Hours required to make one football
Minimum ratio of basketballs to footballs
Minimum number of footballs to produce

description: A handmade sports equipment manufacturing company makes basketballs and footballs. Basketballs require \param{MaterialBasketball} units of materials and \param{HourBasketball} hour to make whereas footballs require \param{MaterialFootball} units of materials and \param{HourFootball} hours to make. The manufacturing company has available \param{TotalMaterial} units of materials and their workers working at max capacity can work for at most \param{TotalHours} hours. Since basketballs sell better, there must be at least \param{BasketballFootballRatio} times as many basketballs as footballs but the manufacturing company would like at least \param{MinFootballs} footballs. How many of each should the manufacturing company make to maximize the total number of sports equipment produced?
